      • Room

        Room(java.lang.String title)

      • Room

        Room(java.util.Scanner s,
     Dungeon d)
throws Room.NoRoomException,
     Dungeon.IllegalDungeonFormatException
        Throws:
        Room.NoRoomException
        Dungeon.IllegalDungeonFormatException

      • Room

        Room(java.util.Scanner s,
     Dungeon d,
     boolean initState)
throws Room.NoRoomException,
     Dungeon.IllegalDungeonFormatException
        Given a Scanner object positioned at the beginning of a "room" file entry, read and return a Room object representing it.
        Parameters:
        d - The containing edu.umw.stephen.bork.Dungeon object, necessary to retrieve edu.umw.stephen.bork.Item objects.
        initState - should items listed for this room be added to it?
        Throws:
        Room.NoRoomException - The reader object is not positioned at the start of a room entry. A side effect of this is the reader's cursor is now positioned one line past where it was.
        IllegalDungeonFormatException - A structural problem with the dungeon file itself, detected when trying to read this room.
        Dungeon.IllegalDungeonFormatException

      • restoreState

        void restoreState(java.util.Scanner s,
                  Dungeon d)
           throws GameState.IllegalSaveFormatException
        Given a Scanner object positioned at the beginning of a "Room" file entry from a .sav file, read and return a Room object representing it.
        Parameters:
        s - scanner object passed by the previous calling (GameState)
        d - current dungeon object created by the restore call in GameState
        Throws:
        GameState.IllegalSaveFormatException

      • describe

        public java.lang.String describe()
        This method prints the details of the room on the console for the player, taking into consideration its contents, exits and the status of the Rooms boolean hasBeen variable. If it is false the Room title and description variables are formated and printed to the console. If is is true then only the title is printed to the console. For both conditions the Item and NPC object names are formated and printed to the console.
        Returns:
        message string to be printed to the console

      • leaveBy

        public Room leaveBy(java.lang.String dir)
        Takes a single character, representing a direction which to exit a Room object, and confirms that and exit with the matching direction exists. If the exit direction is present the exit's destination Room object is return, otherwise the return value is set to null.
        Parameters:
        dir - single character representing the potential direction an exit
        Returns:
        the destination room object

      • addExit

        void addExit(Exit exit)
        Takes an Exit object and adds it to the Room's exits array list.
        Parameters:
        exit - exit object representing a viable movement direction for the player

      • remove

      • getItemNamed

        Item getItemNamed(java.lang.String name)
           throws Item.NoItemException
        Takes in a String as a search parameter, representing the primary name of an Item. Checks the room's contents array list for a match. If match is made returns an Item, otherwise throws exception.
        Parameters:
        name - search parameter, as name of item
        Returns:
        item object
        Throws:
        Item.NoItemException

      • getNpcNamed

        NPC getNpcNamed(java.lang.String name)
         throws NPC.NoNPCException
        Takes in a String as a search parameter, representing the name of a NPC object. Checks the room's npcs array list for a match. If match is made returns an NPC object, otherwise throws exception.
        Parameters:
        name - search parameter, as name of npc
        Returns:
        target npc object
        Throws:
        NPC.NoNPCException
